content: कण्व {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [कण् क्वन्] {%<ab>a.</ab>%} <ab>Ved.</ab> {@--1@} Talented, intelligent. {@--2@} Praising; प्रसक्षणो दिठयः कण्वहोता <ls>Rv. 5. 41. 4.</ls> {@--3@} Fit to be praised or honoured; <ls>Rv. 10. 115. 5.</ls> {@--4@} Deaf. --ण्वः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of a renowned sage, foster-father of Śakuntalā and progenitor of the line of काण्व Brāhmaṇas. He was the author of several hymns of the Ṛgveda. {@--2@} (<ab>Ved.</ab>) A peculiar class of evil spirits against whom charms are used. {@--3@} A praiser. {@--4@} The founder of Vedic schools. --ण्वं Sin, evil.
